canonical_explanation.text: Plants are living things found all around us. They have parts like roots, stem, leaves, flowers, and fruits. There are different types of plants: trees are big and tall, shrubs are medium and bushy, and herbs are small and soft. Plants give us food, shade, wood, and fresh air. They need water, sunlight, and air to grow.
rules: Plants have five main parts: root, stem, leaf, flower, and fruit.
Trees are big and tall with thick, hard stems. Examples: neem, mango, banyan.
Shrubs are medium-sized bushy plants. Examples: rose, hibiscus.
Herbs are small plants with soft stems. Examples: tulsi, mint, coriander.
Plants give us food, oxygen, shade, wood, and medicines.
Plants need water, sunlight, and air to grow.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant is under the ground?
questions.explanation_correct: The root of a plant is under the ground. Roots hold the plant in the soil and take in water from the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves, flowers, and fruits are above the ground. The root is the part of a plant that grows under the ground.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant has bright colours and smells nice?
questions.explanation_correct: Flowers have bright colours and often smell nice. They are the colourful and beautiful part of a plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots are under the ground, stems are usually green or brown, and leaves are mostly green. Flowers are the parts that have bright colours and nice smells.

questions.question_text: Which part of a plant holds the leaves and flowers?
questions.explanation_correct: The stem holds the leaves and flowers. It also carries water from the roots to the other parts of the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots are underground, fruits contain seeds, and seeds grow into new plants. The stem is the part that holds up the leaves and flowers.

questions.question_text: Leaves of most plants are:
questions.explanation_correct: Most plant leaves are green in colour. The green colour helps the plant make its food using sunlight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most leaves are not red, blue, or white. The leaves of most plants are green. Green is the most common colour for leaves.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a tree?
questions.explanation_correct: Mango is a tree. It is big, tall, and has a thick hard stem (trunk). We get mangoes from the mango tree.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tulsi and mint are herbs (small soft plants). Rose bush is a shrub (medium bushy plant). Mango is a big tall tree.

questions.question_text: Which plant is an herb (small and soft)?
questions.explanation_correct: Tulsi is an herb. It is a small plant with a soft green stem. Many Indian homes keep a tulsi plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Neem, banyan, and coconut are all trees. They are big and tall with hard stems. Tulsi is the herb because it is small with a soft stem.

questions.question_text: A shrub is a plant that is:

options.text: A plant that grows in water

questions.explanation_correct: A shrub is medium-sized and bushy. It is bigger than herbs but smaller than trees. Rose and hibiscus are examples of shrubs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shrub is not very tall like a tree or tiny like grass. It is also not a water plant. A shrub is medium-sized with many branches, making it look bushy.

questions.question_text: Which fruit do we get from a tree?
questions.explanation_correct: We get mangoes from a mango tree. Mango is a fruit that grows on trees and is very popular in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk comes from cows, eggs come from hens, and bread is made from wheat. Mango is a fruit that we get from a tree.

questions.question_text: Plants give us fresh:
questions.explanation_correct: Plants give us fresh air (oxygen). They take in bad air and give out fresh air that we breathe. That is why trees are very important.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not give us water, clothes, or books directly. Plants give us fresh air (oxygen) that all living things need to breathe.

questions.question_text: What grows from a seed?
questions.explanation_correct: A new plant grows from a seed. When we put a seed in soil and give it water and sunlight, it grows into a plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stones, animals, and water do not grow from seeds. A seed grows into a new plant when it gets water, sunlight, and soil.

questions.question_text: On a hot sunny day, where do we sit to feel cool?
questions.explanation_correct: We sit under a tree to feel cool on a hot day. Trees give us shade and the area under them is cooler.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sitting in the sun, on the road, or on a rock will make us feel hotter. Under a tree is the best place because trees give us shade and keep us cool.

questions.question_text: If you pull a plant out of the ground, you will see the:
questions.explanation_correct: If you pull a plant out of the ground, you will see the roots. Roots are usually hidden under the soil and they hold the plant in place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flowers, fruits, and seeds are above the ground and can already be seen. When you pull a plant out, you can see the roots that were hidden under the soil.

questions.question_text: Neem is very tall and has a thick, hard stem. What type of plant is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Neem is a tree. Trees are very tall, have thick hard stems (trunks), and many big branches.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs are small with soft stems, shrubs are medium and bushy, and grass is very short. Neem is tall with a thick stem, so it is a tree.

questions.question_text: Rose plant is bushy with thorns. What type of plant is it?
questions.explanation_correct: Rose is a shrub. Shrubs are medium-sized, bushy plants. The rose plant has many branches that spread out and it has thorns.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The rose plant is not a tall tree, a small herb, or a climber. It is a shrub because it is medium-sized and bushy with many branches.

questions.question_text: Which vegetable do we get from plants?
questions.explanation_correct: We get potato from plants. Potato grows under the ground in the soil as part of the plant's root area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk comes from cows, eggs from hens, and fish from water. Potato is a vegetable that we get from plants.

questions.question_text: What do roots do for a plant?

options.text: They hold the plant in the ground and take in water
They give colour to the plant

questions.explanation_correct: Roots hold the plant firmly in the ground and take in water from the soil. Without roots, a plant would fall over and not get water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flowers and fruits grow on the stem and branches, not from roots. Roots have two main jobs: holding the plant in the soil and taking in water.

questions.question_text: We get wood from:
questions.explanation_correct: We get wood from trees. Wood is used to make furniture, doors, paper, and many other things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wood does not come from animals, water, or rocks. We get wood from the stems (trunks) and branches of trees.

questions.question_text: What does a plant need to grow?
questions.explanation_correct: A plant needs water, sunlight, and air to grow. Without these three things, a plant cannot live and grow healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not need toys, books, pencils, or clothes. They need water, sunlight, and air to grow. These are the basic things every plant needs.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the biggest type of plant?
questions.explanation_correct: A tree is the biggest type of plant. Trees like banyan, neem, and mango can grow very tall with thick trunks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Herbs are very small, shrubs are medium-sized, and grass is short. Trees are the biggest type of plant.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the smallest type of plant?
questions.explanation_correct: Herbs are the smallest type of plant. They are small with soft, thin stems. Tulsi and mint are examples of herbs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are the biggest, shrubs are medium, and banyan is a very large tree. Herbs like tulsi and mint are the smallest type of plant.

questions.question_text: Anu's mother uses tulsi leaves when Anu has a cough. What does this show?
questions.explanation_correct: This shows that plants give us medicine. Tulsi is a plant used in Indian homes to treat cough and cold. Many medicines come from plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In this case, tulsi is not being used for shade, wood, or clothes. Tulsi leaves are being used as medicine to help Anu feel better. Plants give us medicines.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant do we eat when we eat an apple?
questions.explanation_correct: When we eat an apple, we eat the fruit of the plant. An apple is a fruit that grows on an apple tree.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not eat the root, stem, or leaf when we eat an apple. An apple is the fruit of the apple tree.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant do we eat when we eat spinach (palak)?
questions.explanation_correct: When we eat spinach (palak), we eat the leaves of the plant. Spinach leaves are green and very healthy for us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not eat the root, flower, or fruit when we eat spinach. Spinach is the leaf of the plant that we cook and eat.

questions.question_text: Carrot grows under the ground. Which part of the plant is a carrot?
questions.explanation_correct: A carrot is the root of the carrot plant. It grows under the ground, just like other roots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves and flowers grow above the ground. Since carrot grows under the ground, it is a root of the plant.

questions.question_text: Coriander (dhaniya) is a small plant with a soft stem. It is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Coriander is an herb. Herbs are small plants with soft stems. We use coriander leaves in Indian cooking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are big and tall, shrubs and bushes are medium-sized. Coriander is small with a soft stem, so it is an herb.

questions.question_text: Why should we not cut down trees?

options.text: Because they give us oxygen, shade, food, and shelter for animals
Because they are hard to cut

questions.explanation_correct: We should not cut down trees because they give us oxygen, shade, food, and a home for birds and animals. Trees are very important for life on Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not just about how trees look, or that they are hard to cut, or have thorns. We should save trees because they give us oxygen to breathe, food, shade, and homes for animals.

questions.question_text: Hibiscus plant has many branches and is medium-sized. It is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Hibiscus is a shrub. Shrubs are medium-sized plants with many branches. They are bushy and shorter than trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hibiscus is not a very tall tree, a small herb, or a creeper. It is medium-sized with many branches, which makes it a shrub.

questions.question_text: What do we call the hard outer covering of a tree stem?
questions.explanation_correct: The hard outer covering of a tree stem is called bark. Bark protects the tree, just like our skin protects our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaves, flowers, and roots are other parts of a tree. The hard outer covering on the stem (trunk) of a tree is called bark.

questions.question_text: Ravi's mother added mint leaves to his lemonade. Which use of plants does this show?
questions.explanation_correct: This shows that plants give us food. Mint is a plant and its leaves are used in food and drinks to add flavour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adding mint leaves to lemonade is about using plants as food, not for shade, wood, or clothes. Plants give us many foods, including herbs like mint.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the correct order from smallest to biggest?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from smallest to biggest is: herb (smallest), shrub (medium), tree (biggest). Herbs are small, shrubs are medium, and trees are the tallest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are not the smallest, and herbs are not the biggest. The correct order from smallest to biggest is: herb, shrub, tree.

questions.question_text: The root of a plant is under the ground.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the root of a plant grows under the ground. It holds the plant in the soil and takes in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Roots grow under the ground. They hold the plant in place and take in water and nutrients from the soil.

questions.question_text: Leaves are usually green in colour.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, leaves of most plants are green in colour. The green colour comes from something inside the leaf that helps the plant make food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Most leaves are green. The green colour in leaves helps the plant use sunlight to make food.

questions.question_text: Trees are smaller than herbs.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Trees are much bigger than herbs. Trees are the biggest type of plant, and herbs are the smallest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees are not smaller than herbs. Trees like neem and banyan are very tall and big, while herbs like tulsi are small.

questions.question_text: Plants give us food.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, plants give us many types of food like fruits, vegetables, rice, wheat, and spices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. We get many foods from plants such as fruits (mango, apple), vegetables (potato, tomato), and grains (rice, wheat).

questions.question_text: Plants do not need water to grow.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Plants need water to grow. Without water, plants become dry and die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants need water to grow and stay healthy. If we do not water a plant, it will become dry and die.

questions.question_text: Banyan is a very big tree.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the banyan tree is a very big tree. It has a wide trunk and spreading branches. It is one of the biggest trees in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The banyan tree is one of the biggest trees found in India. It has many branches and can provide shade to many people.

questions.question_text: Plants need sunlight to grow.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, plants need sunlight to grow. Sunlight helps the leaves make food for the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Plants need sunlight to survive and grow. Without sunlight, a plant cannot make its food and will not grow properly.

questions.question_text: Which of these do we get from coconut trees?
questions.explanation_correct: We get coconuts from coconut trees. Coconut is a fruit that grows on tall coconut palm trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mangoes come from mango trees, roses come from rose bushes, and potatoes grow under the ground. Coconut trees give us coconuts.

questions.question_text: Priya planted a seed. She gave it water and kept it in sunlight. After a few days, a small green plant came out. What came out of the soil first?

options.text: A tiny shoot (baby stem with leaves)

questions.explanation_correct: When a seed grows, a tiny shoot comes out of the soil first. This small baby stem with tiny leaves is the first part of the new plant we can see.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A flower, fruit, or full tree does not come out first. When a seed grows, the first thing we see is a tiny shoot (a small stem with baby leaves) coming out of the soil.

questions.question_text: Match the plant with its use: Neem tree gives us:
questions.explanation_correct: Neem tree gives us medicines and fresh air. Neem leaves are used in many home remedies and medicines in India. Like all trees, it also gives us oxygen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Neem is known for its medicinal properties, not for fruits we commonly eat, cotton, or rice. Neem gives us medicines and fresh air (oxygen).

questions.question_text: Mint grows in a small pot in Seema's kitchen. It has a soft stem. Mint is a:
questions.explanation_correct: Mint is an herb. It is small and has a soft stem. Herbs can grow in small pots and are used in cooking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mint is not a big tree, a bushy shrub, or a climber. Since it is small with a soft stem, it is an herb.

questions.question_text: We get rice from a plant.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we get rice from the rice plant. Rice is a grain that grows in fields called paddy fields.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Rice comes from the rice plant. It is a grain that is grown in wet paddy fields and is the main food in many parts of India.

questions.question_text: What happens to a plant if it does not get water for many days?
questions.explanation_correct: If a plant does not get water for many days, it dries up and dies. Water is very important for a plant to stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Without water, a plant cannot grow bigger or get more flowers. It will become dry, its leaves will fall, and it will die. Plants need water to live.

questions.question_text: Look at these three plants: Banyan (very tall, thick trunk), Rose (medium, bushy), Coriander (small, soft stem). Which one is the shrub?
questions.explanation_correct: Rose is the shrub. It is medium-sized and bushy. Banyan is a tree (very tall) and coriander is an herb (small, soft stem).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Banyan is a tree because it is very tall with a thick trunk. Coriander is an herb because it is small and has a soft stem. Rose is medium-sized and bushy, so it is a shrub.

questions.question_text: Tulsi is a tree.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Tulsi is not a tree. Tulsi is a small plant with a soft stem, so it is an herb.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tulsi is not a tree. It is an herb because it is small and has a soft, thin stem. Trees are much bigger with thick, hard stems.

questions.question_text: Which of these do we get from plants?
questions.explanation_correct: We get fruits and vegetables from plants. Plants give us food like mangoes, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and many more.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Toys, pencil boxes, and phones are made in factories. Fruits and vegetables are what we get directly from plants.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant do we eat when we eat cauliflower (gobi)?
questions.explanation_correct: When we eat cauliflower (gobi), we eat the flower part of the plant. Cauliflower is actually the flower of the plant that has not fully opened.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cauliflower is not a root, stem, or leaf. It is the flower of the cauliflower plant. We eat the flower part when we eat gobi.

questions.question_text: Trees give shade on a hot day.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, trees give shade on a hot day. Their big leaves and branches block the sunlight and create a cool area under them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Trees have big branches and many leaves that block sunlight. Standing under a tree on a hot day keeps us cool because of the shade.

questions.question_text: Divya saw birds making a nest on a big neem tree. What does this show about trees?

options.text: Trees give shelter (home) to birds and animals

questions.explanation_correct: This shows that trees give shelter or a home to birds and animals. Birds build nests on trees to live in and raise their babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While trees do give us food, wood, and medicine, in this case the birds are building a nest. This shows that trees provide shelter (a home) for birds and animals.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant is this: It is green, flat, and makes food for the plant?
questions.explanation_correct: The leaf is green, flat, and makes food for the plant using sunlight. Leaves are very important because they help the plant prepare its own food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roots are under the ground, stems hold the plant up, and fruits contain seeds. The green, flat part that makes food for the plant is the leaf.
